alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Annette Island; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; City of Hyder; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 13 at 2:42PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...Snow Followed by Rain for the Central and Southern Panhandle... The sunny and dry weather ends as an upper low develops over the Gulf midweek. Multiple surface lows are expected to track towards the Panhandle during this time starting Tuesday night and continuing through the weekend. Cold temperatures remain in place through Tuesday night but then gradually warm each day through the weekend, climbing into the 40s by Thursday. Precipitation is expected to start as snow for the central and southern panhandle, but a change to rain should occur late Tuesday night through Wednesday morning. For now, up to 3 inches is possible with a change over to rain limiting any further accumulations. If the change over to rain is delayed some communities could see additional accumulation. This threat will continue to be monitored leading up to and during the event.
